intro: Vangueria volkensii, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water retention. The leaves and roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
